Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. Ready? Come on, show me excited!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes. [small fist-pumps from both Pam and Oscar.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm pretty excited too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today I'm heading over to the job fair at Valley View High School, to find some new interns. Want to get some fresh blood. Um, euthanize this place.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, are we doing this thing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God, Darryl, you look like Barack Obama. Everybody I'm dating Barack Obama!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why are you dressed like that?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [in a dress shirt and tie] Like what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like you're applying for a loan.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Maybe he's going to church. Or court.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Figured I look presentable. [looks Michael over] You? [Michael dressed casually in jeans and sneakers] Went a different way.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Darryl] I think you look nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Darryl
Quote.Text: [simultaneously] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, here's what we're going to do:

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Today, I am meeting a potential client on the golf course, because Ryan put me on probation. You remember Ryan, he was the temp here. Yeah. And uh, it is not a good time for me to lose my job. Since I have some pretty big long term plans in my personal life with Pam, that I'd like her parents to be psyched about. So I am about to do something very bold at this job that I've never done before. Try.

Quote.Speaker: Phil Maguire
Quote.Text: [takes golf swing] Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mr. Maguire, it's been a couple of years.

Quote.Speaker: Phil Maguire
Quote.Text: Hey Jim, how are you, nice to see you man.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh no! No, no-no-no-no! My grandfather would be spinning in his urn, if he knew that I was out here with a Dartmouth boy. You take that shirt off right now or I will take it off for you, sir. I am... totally and completely kidding! [they both laugh] Andrew Bernard, Cornell '95.

Quote.Speaker: Phil Maguire
Quote.Text: Phil Maguire, Dartmouth, '74 [goes to shake Andy's hand]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oop, got some blisties.

Quote.Speaker: Phil Maguire
Quote.Text: Yeah, you do.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hit about 1200 balls last night, in preparation for today, so hands are a little tender. [shows blisters on both hands] It's actually not funny at all. It's incredibly painful.

Quote.Speaker: Phil
Quote.Text: Let's make it interesting, say, uh, ten bucks a hole?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What are we talking? Skins? Acey Duecy? Bingo bango bongo? Sandies, Barkies? Arnies, Wolf? What?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm gonna take this petty cash I got from Oscar, and turn it into next month's rent.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So many memories in this old gym. Pretending I have PMS so I didn't have to play volleyball, pretending I have PMS so I didn't have to play basketball. Those were the days!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Darryl approaches as students throw basketballs] A little over the top, don't you think?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Show them what you brought, Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [holds up single sheet of paper] Um, that's all we brought.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is all we need.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We'll see.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes we will see Oscar, we will see, because a blank sheet of paper equals endless possibilities! Conceptual! All right! We. Are. Open for business! [all four of them sit in an empty booth with small Dunder Mifflin sign] Hello!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Andy, you're up, let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [gushing lotion inside his golf gloves] Giddy up, let's do this.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: People assume I'm great at golf. But like everybody, I hated golf lessons when I was a kid. So, I used to hang out at the sailing club instead. Got my "knot" on.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [swings] Dammit!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Guys, do we have to stay all day?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I mean, Michael's gone, can't we just go?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Yeah, and I finished my work months ago!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excuse me, people. It has come to my attention, some of you have forgotten, who is in charge here. When Michael is gone... Jim is in charge. When Jim is gone, Andy and I are in charge. When Andy is gone you answer to me. Okay? [Stanley gets up to go] Excuse me where do you think you're going? Oh no, no, no. You're not leaving. No! Stanley, do not walk out that door! If you walk out that door, so help me, I will - [Stanley leaves] He left. Last time I checked, the American workday ends at five pm. You will all stay at your desks until that time. Or, you will suffer the consequences.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What consequences?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will tell on you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's some filing, restocking the supply shelves. Replacing the water jug, which nobody likes to do. Um, we... uh, eat a lot of cake!

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] Yeah, and uh, you basically learn how an office runs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello. Hi. [to Pam] Can I talk to you for a sec? Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is Michael, my boss. [she points] Justin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, uh, remember what we talked about, in the car on the way up, "only the best and the brightest."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's nice and he seems interested.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He's totally wrong, Pam. [to Justin] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How you doing? Listen, I don't think that a handsome, funny, smart, funny-looking kid like you, should limit himself. You could do whatever you want to do. You could be a classy janitor, or a cashier with dignity, or a... migraine worker. [takes back the info flyer Justin holds] Maybe for you, paper should be more of a hobby.

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: Sorry for wasting your time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no problem. [looks down] And he signed! He put his name on the piece of - okay, that was supposed to be a blank canvas on which to put their hopes and dreams. And he just, made it into a stupid piece of paper. We need another one, immediately.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, the booth is lame without it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I only brought the one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you mental?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, do you remember, you specifically told me to only bring one sheet of paper? You said it only takes one sheet to make a difference. And I said, "Are you sure Michael?" And you said "Pam! Pam! Pam!" And then you sneezed in my tea, and then you said, "Don't worry, it's just allergies." Do you remember that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... don't.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. I'll go look for another one. [she leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And that. Is why. I need a smart intern.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, so how's the direct mail business going?

Quote.Speaker: Phil
Quote.Text: I can't complain, people love their junk mail.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Now are you getting all your paper from PPC? Or-

Quote.Speaker: Phil
Quote.Text: You know what Jim? I'm not really looking to change things up right now, I just came out here to get out of the office for a little bit, so why don't we just play, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely, will do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So I guess I'll just... work on my short game.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [teen approaches table] Hello there.

Quote.Speaker: Kid
Quote.Text: What is this company?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well it's funny that you should ask, because it's really more than a company...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin paper.

Quote.Speaker: Kid
Quote.Text: Thanks. [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dammit, Oscar!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm trying to lure these kids into my booth, but uh, kids are very wary about being "lured" these days. Thank you Dateline!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you. [hangs up phone, leaves for restroom]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Extension 128.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [over phone] Hiya Pumpkin, it's Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Say, we're gonna ditch this bitch. You in?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Are you out? [Angela hangs up] Pumpkin's out, let's go gang! [they all make a run for the door, Dwight re-enters room with only Angela left]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: My old art room. [finds a sheet of blank paper] Oh, maybe it's still here! [looks for her painting] No. No they must have taken it down. Never mind.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [answers cell] What do you want?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, I know you're swamped. I just thought you should know that everyone in the office has left, except for Angela and I. Do not worry though, I have taken down their names, and I have docked them a personal day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who cares? I'm not there, Jim's not there, why should they have to be there?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So... what else is up? [Michael hangs up] Mich-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you! [Pam hands him blank paper] What, what is this?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A piece of paper.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This isn't Dunder Mifflin paper. Some sort of Pendleton crap.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well I think they'll get the spirit of it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam-Pam-Pam-Pam-PamPamPamPam! We're dying here. I want you to go back to the office and I want you to get the real stuff. I want you to get ultra white card stock.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. And don't call me Shirley.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Phil
Quote.Text: Oh! [Phil is stuck in the sand trap] Ah, dammit!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, you can just pick it up, take the triple bogey.

Quote.Speaker: Phil
Quote.Text: Yeah I'll- I'll get it out. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep. [Maguire keeps swinging]

Quote.Speaker: Angela and Dwight
Quote.Text: [silently working] [Pam walks back into office, gets paper out of the copier, shows it "voila" to camera, leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Jim's cellphone rings] AH! Come on, Tuna!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, can't really talk now, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just checking in, how's it going?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, you know, we'll see, we'll see.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just drove twenty miles round-trip back to the office to get Michael a single sheet of white paper. So, I could have just had them fax it to me, I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I like you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Talk to you later?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. All right. Bye. [Kevin sinks putt] All right. Sorry, I got to annoy you one more time. What if I bring down shipping costs?

Quote.Speaker: Phil
Quote.Text: You can try. But I've looked at your prices. Even with free shipping? Doesn't work. It's just- it's not in the stars, Jim. [Phil sinks putt] Six.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right, race to the next hole! [he runs off to the cart]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ooh! Winner gets ten bucks! Wait -wait for me! Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Shortcut! Shortcut! [drives cart off course, it flips over] Woah! I fell in the sandtrap!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [hums at copier, Angela waiting behind him]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All of these jobs? Suck. I would rather live jobless, on a beach somewhere, off the money from a large inheritance, than to have to work in any one of these crap-holes. They suck.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! [walks up to Oscar and Darryl tossing basketballs, grabs Oscar's ball] Game over. [kicks the ball up to the gymnasium ceiling]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singsong] Just-in time.

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just-in case. What's your last name?

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: Polznik.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This... just in. Justin Polznik! Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Justin is the ugly girl in the movie, who takes off her glasses and she's hot! And you realize she was always hot, she was just wearing glasses. And that you were the blind one. He's the most... important thing in my life right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to meet my family. Come on. Oscar Martinez. Accountant extraordinaire. This is Justin.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is Darryl Philbin. Isn't he big? And you already met her, Pam Beesly, office hottie. She will "do" you. [laughs] No, no. But she has already dated two guys in the office, that we know of, so, this could be number three, you never know?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come here. I would never say this to her face, but she is a wonderful person and a gifted artist.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why, why wouldn't you say that to her face?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, what do you think? Think these guys are nice? The guys I didn't bring are even better. Justin, I'm willing to commit right now. Would you do me the honor, of spending the summer with us, at Dunder Mifflin? I think, I think you are very special.

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: You didn't want me before. That's what you said.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I didn't. You misconstrued me.

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: You were kind of a jerk to me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I, uh, hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: And I'm, I'm gonna go now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't... hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [trying to pick up a beer bottle with blistered hands, struggles trying to take a drink as everyone watches.]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [tries to stop a sneeze] Ah-choo!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Bless you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you. [Angela turns to look at him.]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay, Jim, you owe me one-twenty, and Phil, you owe me two-thirty.

Quote.Speaker: Phil
Quote.Text: Let's open a tab, because you and me are gonna be playing more often.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Count me in!

Quote.Speaker: Phil
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. You had some fun, and uh, I think I paid for it. So let me get my last shot in there. Is there anything you can do for me?

Quote.Speaker: Phil
Quote.Text: I'll tell you what. My fiscal year ends in two months, let's talk then. Sound good?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Maguire
Quote.Text: Good playing with you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know it's a tough thing, seeing a grown man take six shots to get out of a sand trap but, I had to give Phil credit for not quitting. Which is what I told him. I also told him I don't quit either, and I'd call him every single day until he gave me his business. Which he then did, after ...fifteen minutes of me blocking his car. So I am now his paper supplier! And I shot a 102 today, so I'm feeling pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Woman on mic
Quote.Text: The job fair will be closing in five minutes. Eighth period will commence as scheduled.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hold down the fort, I have to do something. [walks up to microphone] Excuse me. If you can hear me, I'd like you to look around at all these companies and know that none of them are good enough for you. H&R Block? Come on, I mean I don't even know what they do. Frank Regan Funeral Home? Too much formaldehyde! The Air Force? [Airforce recruiter glares at Michael] Air Force is cool. The refreshments? Bush league! You know, that's not what you want. Dunder- they, well, okay I see security is coming so I just want to say, come to Dunder Mifflin. Dunder Mifflin, a great place to work! Anybody? Show of hands, anybody want to intern at Dunder Mifflin? We do not offer college credit, we cannot give you any sort of pay, but it is a really fun work environment. Anybody? Show of hands? Damn... it. Okay, I'm gonna wrap it up here. Thank you for your time, and drive safe.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Dwight and Angela exiting, he opens door for her] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [clink of beer bottles] Beers? You closed it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I closed it!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes! Oh! [runs into his arms, kisses him] Um, congratulations to you, sir. [they shake hands business-like]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you. Oh, thank you very much. Appreciate it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you. You know what, screw this! [pulls Pam into a big smooch]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oooh! [Kevin and Andy add suggestive "bow-chicka-wow-wow" vocals]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today I did something stupid. I questioned myself. And I will never do that again. Because I look at somebody like Jim Halpert and I think, that guy can do anything he wants to do. He could do anything, and he chooses to work here, selling paper. Just like me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [standing way too close to Jim and Pam] Yeah, kiss her. Kiss her good. [Jim and Pam stop kissing]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Graphics guy
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I was just wondering, what kind of jobs do you guys have?

Quote.Speaker: Graphics guy
Quote.Text: Are you interested in graphic design?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Can I fill out an application?

Quote.Speaker: Graphics guy
Quote.Text: Oh absolutely, here, take a seat. I should let you know right away, this is just an entry-level job. It's really basic. We're looking for like, a self starter, someone who can meet deadlines, who just pretty much just go the extra mile, I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can do that.

Quote.Speaker: Graphics guy
Quote.Text: Great. And uh, obviously looking for someone who knows Photoshop, and Dreamweaver. Uh, Corel Painter, Illustrator, AfterEffects, all the basics.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know any of those.

Quote.Speaker: Graphics guy
Quote.Text: [laughs] It's actually not super-complicated. I mean I'm sure there's some sort of like, adult education classes in the area. But if you're really serious about graphic design, one thing about New York or Philadelphia, they've got amazing programs out there for design.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: New York or Philadelphia.

Quote.Speaker: Graphics guy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: All right. Cool, well... thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Graphics guy
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And uh, I'll look into those.

Quote.Speaker: Graphics guy
Quote.Text: You should.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: New York or Philadelphia.

Quote.Speaker: Graphics guy
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Graphics guy
Quote.Text: It's where the action is.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, kids today have a very short attention span. They are into texting and video games and sex, and they just, they get distracted easily. And today they're being distracted by the other booths.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clears throat] Hey, there! Michael Scott, regional manager, Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Brad Bailey, nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is a very firm handshake. Ow, ow, aahch! Killing my hand, there.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, what is your poison? You like uh, sales, accounting, customer service, what do you like...

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Sales, uh, sales would be cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sales is and could be very, very cool. If you like paper, and you love to laugh, this is the place for you.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Well, that's great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right here. We have a lot of fun.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Pam returns] This is one of our staff. This is Pam Beesly, [takes piece of paper from Pam] receptionist extraordinaire.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Hey, Pam, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Check that out, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi, nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pretty nice.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She sits there all day.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You get to look at her. Why don't you hold out your hand. [hands Brad paper] Tell me what you feel.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Paper.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's called card stock. That's what you're feeling. Now what you're feeling inside is confusion, butterflies, exhilaration... You're thinking, "Am I good enough for this job? Do I have what it takes?" And I think we both know the answer. We'll find that out together. You can keep that.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Are you sure?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Sweet. [camera zooms in on Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't fold it, though.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We have the Dundies, my birthday, those blow out, and it's sexy, it's sort of a sexy atmosphere, you know? The other day, in the parking lot, I actually found a condom. So. [to Pam] I've been meaning to ask you, do you know whose that was? [Pam shakes head no] So, sexy is fun...

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Well, it was nice meeting you, I'm, I'm gonna take off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, you know what? Coincidence - I am going to go for a little stroll myself. Are you psyched about the summer?

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, me, too.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Okay, well, I'm gonna go to the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, be my guest.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And do your worst.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Brad coming out of the bathroom] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Whoa, come on!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, I forgot to mention that my old temp is now my boss, so, gives you an idea of how quickly you can move up in this...

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Yeah, I get it, okay, I'm not interested. Stop following me around; you're really starting to creep me out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: One other thing I wanted to...

Quote.Speaker: Brad
Quote.Text: Nnn, look. I was just being polite. I don't want to waste my life selling paper for your stupid company, okay? [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] Ohh...Nah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm gonna take so much money off that guy. That guy is a whale. I'm gonna clean him out. This is really gonna get me out of a hole.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: He's not my client.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If your client likes Italian food, you bring him to Cugino's. And if your client likes a little action, you bring him a gambler. And if your client hates Cornell, you bring him Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [tries to break club over knee] Ow! Ow! [tries again] Owooh!

Quote.Speaker: Phil Maguire
Quote.Text: Guy's kind of a douche.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, you know...Cornell.

Quote.Speaker: Phil
Quote.Text: [chuckling] I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Justin!

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, I'm sort of in the middle of this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait, you want this kid to be in the Air Force?

Quote.Speaker: Air Force recruiter
Quote.Text: Absolutely. Justin is smart, capable, ambitious, and he aims high.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Time out. You think this kid could be a fighter pilot?

Quote.Speaker: Air Force recruiter
Quote.Text: I think Justin can be anything he wants to be.

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: [chuckling] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Have you given any more thought to Dunder Mifflin?

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: Well, you took away the brochure, so I sort of...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, yeah, but you don't need the brochure. The brochure is up here [indicates head] and it's in here. [indicates heart]

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think you are smart, and capable, and you aim high.

Quote.Speaker: Justin
Quote.Text: That's what the recruiter just said.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm right.
